newsitem.title: USA: Informix sees Q1 loss, revenue shortfall.
newsitem.headline: Informix sees Q1 loss, revenue shortfall.

text.p: Informix Corp said Tuesday the company expects to experience a substantial operating loss and net loss for the first quarter because of a revenue shortfall.
Informix said it expects revenues for the first quarter ended March 30, 1997, to be in a range of $130 million to $145 million, compared with $204 million in the year-earlier period.

"We saw weakness in all geographic regions, particularly in Europe," said chief executive officer Phil White. "We failed to close a number of large transactions at the end of the quarter for reasons other than competition. In addition, with regard to sales of our UNIX relational database products, we may have lost momentum as a result of sales and marketing over-emphasis on emerging object-relational technology and the lack of corporate focus on our NT products and their price/performance benefits."
Informix currently plans to announce actual results for the first quarter around the end of April.
